title: How to Make Thai Iced Coffee

steps.headline: Place the coffee powder in a filter over a saucepan.
steps.description: Traditional Thai coffee actually uses a blend of ground coffee beans, corn, and soybeans. Place 2 tablespoons (26 g) of Thai coffee powder in a stainless steel muslin coffee filter that's fitted over a small saucepan. You can find Thai coffee at Asian grocery stores or online retailers.

steps.headline: Spill boiling water over the coffee in the filter and drain it  into a second pan.
steps.description: With the coffee in the filter, pour 2 cups (473 ml) of boiling water through the filter. Lift the filter from the pan and move it to a second saucepan, allowing the liquid to drain fully. Move the filter quickly to the second pot to avoid spilling any of the coffee.

steps.headline: Pour the liquid back through the filter and into the original saucepan.
steps.description: Once all of the liquid has passed through the filter, move the filter back to the original saucepan. Pour the coffee from the second pan through the filter, so it winds up in the original pan.

steps.headline: Repeat the process with the second saucepan.
steps.description: When you've filtered the coffee back into original saucepan, move the filter back to the second pan. Pour the coffee from the first pan through the filter again, collecting it in the second pan.

steps.headline: Add sugar to a glass.
steps.description: To mix the iced coffee, you'll need a tall glass. Place 2 to 3 tablespoons (25 to 38 g) of granulated sugar in the bottom of the glass, depending on how sweet you like your coffee. You can use a sugar substitute in place of the sugar if you prefer.

steps.headline: Mix some coffee and creamer into the glass.
steps.description: With the sugar in the glass, pour some of the coffee that you filtered in, along with half and half to taste. Stir the mixture together well. You can substitute any creamer than you like for the half and half. Even with the added sugar, some people prefer sweetened condensed milk.

steps.headline: Transfer the coffee to a large mug with crushed ice.
steps.description: Once the coffee is mixed with the sugar and creamer, fill a large, wide mug with crushed ice. Pour the coffee mixture over it, add a straw, and serve immediately. You should have enough coffee to make 2 to 3 Thai iced coffees.

methods.name: Whipping Up Homemade Thai Iced Coffee

steps.headline: Grind the coffee beans and cardamom pods together.
steps.description: Add ¾ cup (51 g) of French roast or another dark roast coffee beans and 5 green cardamom pods to a coffee grinder. Pulse the mixture until it's finely ground, which should take approximately 15 seconds. You can find green cardamom pods at Asian grocery stores, spice markets, and many general grocery stores. Online retailers also sell it. If you don't have a coffee grinder, you can use your blender to grind the coffee mixture.

steps.headline: Place the coffee mixture in a drip coffee maker and brew it.
steps.description: Once the coffee beans and cardamom are ground together, add the mixture to the filter of a drip coffee maker. Next, fill the top of the coffee machine with water and brew the coffee according to the manufacturer's instructions.

steps.headline: Pour the coffee into a pitcher and allow to cool.
steps.description: When the coffee is brewed, transfer it to a large heatproof pitcher. Let it sit out until it reaches room temperature, which should take about 30 to 60 minutes.

steps.headline: Chill the coffee for at least 2 hours.
steps.description: Once the coffee reaches room temperature, place the pitcher in the refrigerator. Allow it to chill for at least 2 hours or up to overnight.

steps.headline: Add some coffee and condensed milk to a glass.
steps.description: To make a serving of the coffee, pour approximately ⅓ cup (79 ml) into a glass. Add a tablespoon (19 g) of sweetened condensed milk to the coffee, and mix the two to combine.

steps.headline: Top the coffee with ice and serve.
steps.description: When the coffee and sweetened condensed milk are mixed, add some crushed ice to the glass. Stir the mixture again, and serve immediately. You'll have enough coffee to make 12 servings of Thai iced coffee.

steps.headline: Mix the water, instant coffee, condensed milk, and cardamom.
steps.description: Add 2 cups (473 ml) of cold water, 2 to 3 tablespoons (12 to 18 g) of instant coffee granules that have been dissolved in 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of boiling water, ⅓ cup (102 g) of sweetened condensed milk, and ⅛ teaspoon (¼ g) of ground cardamom to a large pitcher. Stir well to ensure that the ingredients are fully combined. You can adjust the amount of instant coffee you use based on how strong you like your brew.

steps.headline: Add ice to four glasses.
steps.description: When the coffee mixture is combined, set out four tall glasses. Fill each with as much ice as you'd like.

steps.headline: Pour the coffee mixture over the ice and add half and half.
steps.description: Divide the coffee mixture between the four glasses. Next, top each glass with 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of half and half and serve immediately. The recipe makes enough for 4 Thai iced coffees.
